member.name: T:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader
member.summary: The main class for using compute shader class (Direct3D 11)

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.Device
member.summary: The device connected to this compute shader.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ComputeShader.CompileComputeShader(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compile the compute shader from a file stored in the disk.
member.param: The path to the compute shader (relative to the solution this code is in)
The main kernel function of the shader (1 kernel function for every compute shader class)
The type and version of the shader. default = cs_5_0. (cs is for Compute shader) (5_0 is for shader model 5.0)
member.returns: Returns the byte code of the compiled shader

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode
member.summary: An enum for the methods of accessing raw data using the cpu.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode.Read
member.summary: The cpu can only read the raw data.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode.Write
member.summary: The cpu can only write to the raw data.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: The cpu can both read from the raw data and write to it.

member.summary: The device connected to this resource.

The main kernel function of the shader

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SetRWTexture2D(ComputeShaders.CSTexture2D,System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the texture to a RWTexture2D in the current compute shader. This function is can be called only once, even if a new compute shader is set using . The only case to call this again is if a new compute shader is set and the in that new shader is different from the old shader, then this function must be called again with be the new uav index.
member.param: The texture to be set.
the register index of the texture in the compute shader.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SetRWTexture2DArray(ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the texture to a RWTexture2DArray in the computeShader. This function is can be called only once, even if a new compute shader is set using . The only case to call this again is if a new compute shader is set and the in that new shader is different from the old shader, then this function must be called again with be the new uav index.
member.param: The texture to be set.
the register index of the texture in the compute shader.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SetBuffer``1(ComputeShaders.CSCBuffer{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the buffer to a cbuffer in the computeShader. This function is can be called only once, even if a new compute shader is set using . The only case to call this again is if a new compute shader is set and the in that new shader is different from the old shader, then this function must be called again with be the new uav index.
member.param: The buffer to be set.
the register index of the buffer in the compute shader.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SetRWStructuredBuffer``1(ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the structured buffer to a RWStructuredBuffer in the computeShader. This function is can be called only once, even if a new compute shader is set using . The only case to call this again is if a new compute shader is set and the in that new shader is different from the old shader, then this function must be called again with be the new uav index.
member.param: The structured buffer to be set.
the register index of the buffer in the compute shader

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SetUnorderedAccessView``1(ComputeShaders.ShaderResource{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: connects the resource to a read/write resource in the computeShader (UAV). This function is can be called only once, even if a new compute shader is set using . The only case to call this again is if a new compute shader is set and the in that new shader is different from the old shader, then this function must be called again with be the new uav index.
member.param: The resource to be set.
the register index of the read/write resource in the compute shader

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.Flush
member.summary: Sends queued-up commands in the command buffer to the graphics processing unit (GPU).

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.Synchronize
member.summary: Synchronizes the gpu with the cpu.

member.summary:
Runs the current compute shader in use.
To know the current compute shader in use see .
member.param: Number of threads in the x-axis
Number of threads in the y-axis
Number of threads in the z-axis

member.summary: Sets the current compute shader in use to .

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the unmanaged data.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSDevice.SameNativeDevice(ComputeShaders.CSDevice)
member.summary: Returns whether this device and share the same native d3d11 device.

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags
member.summary: Describes parameters that are used to create a device. see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/ne-d3d11-d3d11_create_device_flag for more information.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.SingleThreaded
member.summary: Use this flag if your application will only call methods of Direct3D 11 interfaces from a single thread. By default, the ID3D11Device object is thread-safe. By using this flag, you can increase performance. However, if you use this flag and your application calls methods of Direct3D 11 interfaces from multiple threads, undefined behavior might result.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.Debug
member.summary: Creates a device that supports the debug layer. To use this flag, you must have D3D11*SDKLayers.dll installed; otherwise, device creation fails. To get D3D11_1SDKLayers.dll, install the SDK for Windows 8. To see the debug information while using compute shaders use "Immediate Window" in visual studio.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.SwitchToRef
member.summary: This flag is not supported in Direct3D 11.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.PreventThreadingOptimizations
member.summary: Prevents multiple threads from being created. When this flag is used with a Windows Advanced Rasterization Platform (WARP) device, no additional threads will be created by WARP and all rasterization will occur on the calling thread. This flag is not recommended for general use. See remarks.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.BgraSupport
member.summary: Creates a device that supports BGRA formats ( and ). All 10level9 and higher hardware with WDDM 1.1+ drivers support BGRA formats.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.Debuggable
member.summary: This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.PreventAlteringLayerSettingsFromRegistry
member.summary: This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.DisableGpuTimeout
member.summary: This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.VideoSupport
member.summary: This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1.

member.name: F:ComputeShaders.CSDeviceCreationFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.param: The new data

member.summary: Updates the data stored in the buffer using the cpu.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.GetData(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0}@)
member.summary: Copy the data in the buffer to the list using the cpu. NOTE: of must be bigger than or equal to
member.param: the list to copy to

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.UpdateSubresource(System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Updates the resource with the raw data from using the cpu.
Note that this function avoids the trouble of dealing with byte alignment in textures. So data here can be passed without the need to be padded.
member.param: The pointer to the data.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.CopyTo(ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer{`0})
member.summary:
Copy the contents of this resource to .
Note that if both resources share the same device, then the copy is done on the GPU, otherwise it is done on the CPU ( must be true for both)

member.summary:
Copy some contents of this resource to .
Note that if both resources share the same device, then the copy is done on the GPU, otherwise it is done on the CPU ( must be true for both)
member.param: The element index to start copy from.
The element index to start copy to.
The number of elements to copy.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Share(ComputeShaders.CSDevice)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSStructuredBuffer`1.Share(System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.AccessSliceRawData(System.Action{ComputeShaders.TextureDataBox},ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gives the cpu access to the raw data stored in a slice (a single texture in the texture array) in the resource (by mapping https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/ns-d3d11-d3d11_mapped_subresource). During mapping:
- GPU access to the resource is denied.
- The size of the first dimension of the resource (length in buffer, width in texture...) in bytes is rounded to the closest multiple of 16 that is larger than or equal to the original size.
Note that must be true, and that all the accessing can only be done inside ..
member.param: The action to access the data.
The mode of access.
The index of the texture (slice) in the texture array.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Share(ComputeShaders.CSDevice)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture2DArray.Share(System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.summary:
Updates a slice (a subresource) in the texture array with the raw data from using the cpu.
Note that this function avoids the trouble of dealing with byte alignment in textures. So data here can be passed without the need to be padded.
member.param: The pointer to the data.

Copy the contents of this resource to .
Note that if both resources share the same device, then the copy is done on the GPU, otherwise it is done on the CPU ( must be true for both)
member.param: The x index to start copying from.
The y index to start copying from.
The z index to start copying from.
The x index to start copying to.
The y index to start copying to.
The z index to start copying to.
The number of pixels to copy along the x-axis.
The number of pixels to copy along the y-axis.
The number of pixels to copy along the z-axis.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture3D.Share(ComputeShaders.CSDevice)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.CSTexture3D.Share(System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Creates a resource that Gives its device () access to a shared resource (this resource) created on a different device (this resource's device). In other words, it creates a resource with that is connected to this resource's device through this resource. There are important notes regarding shared resources:
- If any of the two shared resources (the result resource and this resource) is updated, must be called.
- In some cases, updating a shared resource and using might causes problems if that shared resource was used with an asynchronous function. For example, when is used then is called using that shared resources. In such cases, it is adviced to call afterwards.
member.param: another device.

member.summary: A struct that contains measurement data from .

member.name: T:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1
member.summary: A base class for all shader Resources (exept constant buffer).

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.ResourceNativePointer
member.summary: The native pointer to the sharpDX resource.

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.Device
member.summary: The device connected to this resource.

member.name: P:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.CPU_ReadWrite
member.summary: The ability to read/write the resource raw data by cpu. When true, it enables the cpu to read/write the resource raw data. However, enabling it increases memory usage to almost double.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.AccessRawData(System.Action{ComputeShaders.TextureDataBox},ComputeShaders.CPUAccessMode)
member.summary:
Gives the cpu access to the raw data stored in the resource (by mapping https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/ns-d3d11-d3d11_mapped_subresource). During mapping:
- GPU access to the resource is denied.
- The size of the first dimension of the resource (length in buffer, width in texture...) in bytes is rounded to the closest multiple of 16 that is larger than or equal to the original size. If you want to avoid this problem you can use UpdateSubresource()
Note that must be true, and that all the accessing can only be done inside ..
member.param: The action to access the data.
The mode of access.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.CopyResource(ComputeShaders.ShaderResource{`0})
member.summary:
An asynchronous call that copies the entire contents of the source resource to the destination resource using the GPU. This call has a few restrictions, the source resource (this) and :
- Must be different resources.
- Must share the same .
- Must be the same type.
- Must have identical dimensions (including width, height, depth, and size as appropriate).
- Must have compatible (if they were textures), which means the formats must be identical or at least from the same type group. For example, a texture can be copied to a texture since both of these formats are in the group.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.EnableCPU_Raw_ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables .

member.summary: Creates an for the resource.

member.name: M:ComputeShaders.ShaderResource`1.DisablesCPU_Raw_ReadWrite
member.summary: Disables .
